results.title: Earthquakes and volcanoes
results.brief_description: The forces that cause earthquakes and volcanoes. Wherever the earth has been folded up into mountains, cracks may appear in the crust. When blocks of earth move along these cracks, or faults, earthquakes may occur. If melted rock is near a fault or weak spot in the crust, it may be forced out to produce a volcanic eruption.
results.description: The forces that cause earthquakes and volcanoes. Wherever the earth has been folded up into mountains, cracks may appear in the crust. results.title: Earthquakes
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Earthquakes are evidence of the heat energy that powers movement in the Tectonic Plates. Although they cause destruction, the upheaval of the landscape to produce different elevations is ultimately benficial to the Earth. Without this variance, the power of erosion would turn the surface of the Earth into a vast desert plain. Geologists are fascinated by the measurement of earth movements and this episode examines some of these including the Richter Scale and the use of seismic waves to locate and identify the location and source of earthquakes.

results.title: Earthquake! (PC)
results.brief_description: Witness the devastation of the powerful forces of mother nature as she lashes out across San Francicso, Mexico City and Alaska, leaving a path of destruction in her wake. Journey also into the Earth to discover why these tragedies occur and why they will continue. This CD ROM also explores areas such as tsunamis and geysers, faults and folds, and quake science, thus providing a useful teaching tool to any study of earth science.

results.title: Earthquake
results.creator_credit: Film Associates and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Uses animation to demonstrate how an earthquake takes place. Shows the effects of earthquakes on landforms and on man-made structures. Explains how scientists learn more about earthquakes by studying the vibrations produced. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Earthly beings
results.creator_credit: Heaping Teaspoon Animation, Chuck Eyler and Jacolyn Kildare
results.brief_description: An animated film depicting nature and the way it feeds upon itself. Ink and paint illustrations are from the works of anatomist, Andreas Vesalius of Brussels 1514-1564, Music is composed and conducted by Katherine Alisa Arnold

results.title: Earthlings can do anything
results.brief_description: This is a video package for upper primary school students which can be used in a number of curriculum areas, most appropriately for science/technology studies and careers/personal development. The emphasis is on developing the talents and skills of girls in traditional male dominated curriculum areas.
